NEW YORK , March 11 -lrb- afp -rrb- the world 's most powerful fine art auction house , Sotheby 's and Christie 's , have agree to pay 40 million dollar to settle a international price-fixing scam , Sotheby 's say .
the payment , if approve by the court , would settle a slew of suit by client over auction hold between 1993 and 2000 outside the United States , it say in a statement .
`` under the term of the settlement agreement , Sotheby 's and Christie 's will each pay 20 million dollar , '' say Sotheby 's , which operate in 34 country .
the deal require threaten british and canadian claim against both auction house to be drop .
buyer and seller also would have to agree not to pursue further case in foreign court .
the litigation cover buyer in auction outside the United States between January 1 , 1993 and February 7 , 2000 , and seller between September 1 , 1995 and February 7 , 2000 .
similar claim over us-based auction be settle in a agreement strike in September 2000 for a total of 512 million dollar .
in December 2001 , a Manhattan jury convict Sotheby 's main shareholder and former chairman Alfred Taubman of enter into a price-fixing agreement with Christie 's .
four month later , the billionaire be sentence to one year in prison and a 7.5-million-dollar fine over the price-fixing , which prosecutor say have cost client of both firm 400 million dollar .
Christie 's be not prosecute in the United States after its management agree to testify against Sotheby 's and provide document need to prove fraudulent intent .
together , Sotheby 's and Christie 's control more than 90 percent of the fine art and antique market .
Sotheby 's say it would record the 20-million-dollar settlement as a special charge for 2002 .
it would be fund in two payment of 10 million dollar each upon preliminary and final court approval .

JAKARTA , March 27 -lrb- afp -rrb- Indonesia will delay the execution of six convict include a indian on death row after five of they appeal to the Supreme Court for a second review , prosecutor say Thursday .

a convict can file a case review or appeal for presidential clemency only after the Supreme Court uphold a sentence impose by a lower court .

Narcotics abuse be a increasingly serious problem in the country .

amnesty oppose the death penalty for any crime .

it be the first execution for five year .
a police firing squad enforce the penalty .

NKorea offer to scrap nuke , missile program but want big concession : US by Matthew Lee ATTENTION - UPDATES / / / WASHINGTON , April 28 -lrb- afp -rrb- - North Korea have offer to scrap its nuclear weapon and missile program , but only in return for `` considerable '' diplomatic , political and economic concession , the United States say Monday .
Secretary of State Colin Powell say the offer be make during three-way talk between US , north korean and chinese diplomat last week in Beijing .
at the same meeting Pyongyang confirm it have nuclear weapon , and threaten to prove it with a `` display . ''
`` the North Koreans acknowledge a number of thing that they be do and , in effect , say that these be now up for further discussion , '' he tell reporter at the State Department .
`` they do put forward a plan that would ultimately deal with they nuclear capability and they missile activity , but they , of course , expect something considerable in return , '' Powell say .
`` we be study that plan , we be examine it with we friend and ally , '' Powell say , add that talk be now underway with the south korean , japanese , russian and australian as well as other government .
`` it be useful to get it all out on the table and see where we go from here , '' he say , refer to the April 23 to 25 discussion in Beijing .
Powell give no indication as to whether Washington would accept the offer , and do not address what Pyongyang be demand in term of concesssion .
however other US official say the North Koreans have present a lengthy list of demand .
the demand include full normalization of tie with the United States , security guarantee and economic assistance that include oil and other energy consideration .
`` they have quite a list of thing , '' State Department spokesman Richard Boucher tell reporter .
ask specifically about normalization of relation and economic assistance , Boucher reply : `` I do not really quibble with that characterization of the list . ''
a senior State Department official say later that the list of demand be so extensive that it defy a `` concise description . ''
`` it basically list everything they have ever ask for , '' the official tell reporter on condition of anonymity , identify oil and energy supplies as demand .
although the north korean demand be be look at , Boucher repeat long-standing US policy that Washington would not be blackmail or otherwise threaten into buy Pyongyang off .
`` we have make clear we be not go to pay for elimination of the nuclear weapon program that never should have begin in the first place , '' he say .
Powell acknowledge that North Korea have hint it could prove it possess nuclear weapon with some sort of display during the Beijing talk , but maintain that the North Koreans have not use the word `` test '' or `` testing . ''
`` they say that it be the kind of capability that one can display in one way or another , '' he say .
the concession demand by Pyongyang be part of a `` bold '' proposal for address the nuclear situation on the korean peninsula that North Korea present in Beijing , official say .
south korean newspaper report earlier Monday that the North suggest that Pyongyang and Washington act simultaneously and equally to resolve the six-month-old nuclear crisis .
Boucher rule out simultaneous step by both side , stress that Washington would not consider such move until the `` verifiable and irreversible termination '' of the north 's nuclear program .
`` we -lrb- have -rrb- make clear that once North Korea do that , we could move on or move back to the comprehensive approach to US-North Korea relation that we have talk about before , '' he say .
South Korea 's Munhwa Ilbo newspaper and other quote unnamed south korean government source as say Pyongyang also urge Washington not to hinder its effort to establish and improve tie with Seoul and Tokyo .
the North 's ruling Workers Party newspaper , Rodong Sinmun , indicate Sunday that North Korea want economic and political `` reward '' from the United States in return for the elimination of its nuclear program .
Rodong call for a `` fair and equal '' footing in talk with the United States , blast Washington for insist that there would be `` no security of the system nor provision of reward '' even if Pyongyang give up its nuclear program .
it insist North Korea could do `` everything '' to defend itself if the United States `` legally guarantee no use of arm include nuke '' .

hundred of case of water be stack on three of the truck .
the rest carry box of tuna , cracker , sweet and other food .

people line up along the street , give thumbs-up sign to the aid convoy as it roll by and beg for food and cigarette .
after day of fierce fighting that shut down the city of Umm Qasr , iraqi youth cheer and swarm british troops as they hand out yellow meal packet and bottle of water Wednesday .
the troops , already in the city , be not part of the aid convoy .
`` Umm Qasr be now secure _ as a port and as a town , '' say Brig. Jim Dutton of the Royal Marines .
the town 's deepwater port , the only one in Iraq , be essential for any relief effort .

it be to begin the six-hour journey into Umm Qasr on Wednesday , accord to a pool report .
Iraqis have about five week of food leave , accord to estimate by the World Food Program .
about 13 million people _ 60 percent of Iraq 's 22 million _ be completely dependent on food handout , the World Food Program , a U.N. agency , say it would make its biggest single request for cash in its history _ more than us$ 1 billion to help feed the war-stricken nation for about six month .
`` this could well turn into the largest humanitarian operation in history , '' say agency spokesman Trevor Rowe .
before the war , Iraqis depend on government ration distribute under the U.N. 's oil-for-food program .
the 7-year-old program allow Iraq to sell unlimited quantity of oil to buy food , medicine and other humanitarian goods .
the proceeds from oil sale be deposit in a u.n.-controlled escrow account .
the war have throw the future of that program in doubt .
because the United States and Britain fail to get U.N. back for the war , Russia , France , Germany and China want to ensure that the immediate humanitarian cost of the war be pay by the United States _ and not the United Nations .

he claim , though , that Iraq can fend for itself : `` Iraq do not need any humanitarian assistance .
we be a rich country . ''

MOSCOW -lrb- AP -rrb- Russia have accept a us$ 150 million World Bank loan to combat the spread of aids and tuberculosis , end a negotiate process that last four year , World Bank official say Friday .
the World Bank first offer the loan in 1999 , but disagreement over treatment keep the project on hold .
Russia object to World Bank rule that require monitoring of patient receive medication , the World Bank say .
but after drawn-out talk , President Vladimir Putin sign off on the loan , which will take effect this year , the World Bank say .
`` Russia have one of the fastest grow AIDS epidemic in the world '' and have a `` fearsome '' problem with tuberculosis , particularly drug-resistant strain , say Olesoji Adeyi , a World Bank health specialist .
`` it be a potential dual epidemic , '' he say , add that people with immune system weaken by the aids virus be especially vulnerable to contract tb , which he call a `` opportunistic disease . ''
AIDS come relatively late to Russia , but spread rapidly , primarily due to intravenous drug abuse and a lack of prevention program .
official have register more than 230,000 case of hiv , though health expert say the actual number of hiv infection top 1 million .
tuberculosis , meanwhile , have also emerge as a serious problem , particularly in Russia 's overcrowded prison .

JAKARTA , Indonesia -lrb- AP -rrb- the dictator Suharto have fall , the constitution have change , the media be unshackled , democratic election hold , and East Timor free .
after Sept. 11 , 2001 , Indonesia be quick to sign onto U.S. President George W. Bush 's global war on terror .
yet , Washington maintain a 12-year ban on arm sale to the world 's most populous muslim nation with the aim of curb human rights abuse still happen despite momentous political change .
frustrated , Jakarta 's general be look elsewhere to replace antiquated arsenal .
later this month indonesian President Megawati Sukarnoputri travel to Moscow to seek the Kremlin 's help in modernize she increasingly obsolete 300,000-member armed force .
she be also likely to open the way for russian company to vie for lucrative deal in the oil and gas sector , long dominate by american and british resource giant .
although opposite end of the Earth , Indonesia and Russia have some basic thing in common .
both be geographically sprawl with massive multiethnic population .
both be struggle to preserve national unity as they fight separatism and build democracy after the collapse of decade of authoritarian rule .
both be resource-rich , but face huge economic problem make worse by endemic corruption .
and , currently , both have oppose the U.S. - lead war on Iraq .
Indonesia 's Foreign Ministry spokesman Marty Natalegawa say Megawati 's meeting with Russian President Putin slate for April 21 will touch on the Iraq crisis .
but other diplomat say that issue will serve primarily to bring the two closer together on bottom-line issue such as trade and arm sale .
analyst worry that Indonesia 's military be now so degraded it can no longer control the border of the far-flung archipelago , allow for easy infiltration by extremist .
last year 's Bali bombing , which kill 202 people , illustrate the threat of terrorism in Indonesia .
and , broad opposition to the u.s.-led attack on Iraq threaten to lead to a backlash by militant Islamists .
`` nearly everybody in Indonesia see this Iraq war as completely unnecessary and there be widespread public opposition to U.S. policy , '' say Jusuf Wanadi of the Center for Strategic and International Studies in Jakarta .
close tie between Moscow and Jakarta be not unprecedented .
Indonesia rely on soviet military assistance in the 1950s under Megawati 's father and found President Sukarno , but these be sever after the anti-communist Gen. Suharto seize power in 1965 .
the United States quickly become the southeast asian country 's main weapon supplier , and annual arm sale peak at us$ 400 million in the 1980 .
in 1991 , however , the U.S. Congress ban this after indonesian troops kill hundred of civilian in East Timor .
in 1999 , East Timor become free , but only after indonesian force lay waste to it as they withdraw after a pro-independence referendum .
the shocking level of destruction prompt U.S. lawmaker to expand the ban to cover almost all military tie with Indonesia .
since then some in the Bush administration _ particularly Deputy Defense Secretary Paul Wolfowitz , a former ambassador to Jakarta and a prime architect of the Iraq war _ have push for the ban to be repeal .
so far , U.S. lawmaker have reinstate only a limited officer training program .
but that be far from enough for Indonesia 's general .
`` I think the indonesian military have finally decide that restriction and conditionality from Washington be just not worth it , '' say Juwono Sudarsono , a former defense minister .
`` so they want to look for alternative source for plane , helicopter and other hardware . ''
Moscow have already have some success in woo Indonesia as a customer .
Jakarta have recently purchase some russian weapon , include 10,000 Kalashnikov assault rifle , a squadron of naval mil-2 helicopter and a dozen btr-80a amphibious carrier for its marine .
currently , Indonesia use short-range rapier missile purchase 30 year ago to protect its vital oil and natural gas field in Sumatra , Borneo and Papua from air attack .
`` replenish they have be a big problem , '' Sudarsono say .
Air defense commander want to augment the rapier with Russia 's impressive long-range s-300 missile , or shorter-range system such as the SA-15 Gauntlet or shoulder-fired igla .
the Air Force be reportedly consider purchase several squadron of Sukhoi su-27 interceptor , consider the world 's premier dogfighter .
previously , indonesian Air Force commander prefer western jet that be compatible with the u.s.-made f-16 fighter-bomber already in the indonesian inventory .
but neighbor Malaysia 's success in integrate russian mig-29 and american f/a -18 Hornets persuade they otherwise , Sudarsono say .
if Megawati do stiff-arm the United States on the weapon issue , it be unlikely relation with Washington will be permanently damage .
whatever happen , Indonesia , a mainly muslim but politically secular state , be natural ally in the struggle against terrorism and religious militancy .
what could be more worry for Washington be Russia 's economic ambition .
Trade between Indonesia and Russia increase by dlr 36.2 million to dlr 203.5 million in 2001 _ the last year for which statistics be available .
analyst say this can only grow .
the real concern , though , be in the petroleum sector .
Megawati and Putin be expect to sign agreement to give russian company a toehold in Indonesia 's oil and gas industry , long dominate by american and british giant such as Exxon Mobil and BP .
PRAGUE , Czech Republic -lrb- AP -rrb- the troubled nuclear power plant in Temelin receive permission from state authority Monday to start power production at full capacity .
Pavel Pitterman , the spokesman for the State Office for Nuclear Safety , say he office give the plant permission to run its second , newer 1,000-megawatt unit at full capacity .
the plant 's first 1,000-megawatt unit have already operate at full capacity during past test .
the spokesman for the Temelin plant , Milan Nebesar , say that a 18-month trial production at full capacity at the second unit , need to declare the unit ready for commercial production , would start Friday .
the plant , base on russian design and upgrade with U.S. technology , have be plague by frequent , non-nuclear malfunction since testing begin in November 2000 .
locate just 60 kilometer -lrb- 35 mile -rrb- north of the austrian border , it have be a source of friction between the two country .
critic in non-nuclear Austria argue the plant be unsafe and demand that it be shut down , but Czech authority insist the plant be safe .
the plant 's first unit , currently shut down for plan maintenance schedule to take two month , have already enter the last stage of test and should be ready for commercial use at the end of 2003 .
UR , Iraq -lrb- AP -rrb- a u.s.-sponsored forum that bring iraqi opposition leader together to shape the country 's postwar government begin Tuesday with a U.S. promise not to rule Iraq and conclude with a agreement to meet again in 10 day .
meet in the biblical birthplace of the prophet Abraham , delegate from Iraq 's many faction discuss the role of religion in the future government and way to rebuild the country .
but some shiite muslim group boycott the meeting and thousand protest nearby .
a 13-point statement release after the meeting stress the need to work toward a democratic Iraq build on the rule of law and equality .
it also call for dissolve Saddam 's Baath Party but leave open the question of separate church from the state .
retire Lt. Gen. Jay Garner , who will head the u.s.-led interim administration in Iraq , open the conference under a golden-colored tent in the shadow of the 4,000-year-old ziggurat at Ur , a terraced temple platform of the ancient Sumerians .
`` what better birthday can a man have than to begin it not only where civilization begin but where a free Iraq and a democratic Iraq will begin today ? ''
say Garner , who turn 65 Tuesday and wear a twin american and iraqi flag pin on he blue shirt .
White House envoy Zalmay Khalilzad tell delegate that the United States have `` no interest , absolutely no interest , in ruling Iraq . ''
`` we want you to establish you own democratic system base on iraqi tradition and value , '' Khalilzad say .
`` I urge you to take this opportunity to cooperate with each other . ''
participant include Kurds , Sunnis and Shiites from inside the country and other who spend year in exile .
U.S. official invite the group , which pick they own representative .
many Iraqis boycott the meeting in opposition to U.S. plan to install Garner atop a interim administration .
thousand of Shiites _ who constitute Iraq 's most populous religious group but be repress under Saddam Hussein _ demonstrate in nearby Nasiriyah , chant `` no to America and no to Saddam ! ''
`` Iraq need a iraqi interim government .
anything other than this trample the rights of the iraqi people and will be a return to the era of colonization , '' say Abdul Aziz Hakim , a leader of the largest iraqi shiite group , the Supreme Council for Islamic Revolution in Iraq .
U.S. official hope more Iraqis join the process and stress that this be just the first of many such meeting in Iraq .
the meeting conclude with the delegate vote by show of hand to meet again in 10 day .
a national conference be plan to select the interim administration , perhaps within week , a senior U.S. official say on condition of anonymity .
the interim administration could begin hand power back to iraqi official within three to six month , but form a government will take longer , say Maj. Gen. Tim Cross , the top british member of Garner 's team .
`` one have to go through the process of building from the bottom up , allow the leadership to establish itself , and then the election process to go through and so forth , '' Cross say .
`` that full electoral process may well take longer . ''
Garner 's Office of Reconstruction and Humanitarian Assistance be charge with coordinate humanitarian assistance , rebuild infrastructure shatter by year of war and U.N. sanction , and gradually hand back power to Iraqis lead a democratically elect government .
Tuesday 's meeting be the first step toward that goal after the ouster of Saddam .
Sheik Ayad Jamal Al Din , a shiite religious leader from Nasiriyah , urge the delegate to craft a secular government , accord to a pool report .
but Nassar Hussein Musawi , a schoolteacher , disagree : `` those who would like to separate religion from the state be simply dream , '' he say .
iraqi exile Hatem Mukhliss quote President John F. Kennedy 's exhortation , `` ask not what you country can do for you , but what you can do for you country , '' and call on Iraqis to write a constitution , establish a legal system and consider what role the army should play .
he ask coalition representative to address problem of security , electricity and water in Iraq and help rebuild destroy and loot hospital .
`` Saddam reduce the country to such a state that it be necessary for people to sell off personal possession , '' Mukhliss say .
`` now it be time to take we country back . ''
there be already tension between the United States and some iraqi faction .
kurdish group appear unwilling to compromise on they demand to expand the border of they autonomous area to include the oil-rich city of Kirkuk and Kurdish part of the city of Mosul .
that could pose a problem for the United States , because Turkey worry that kurdish control of Kirkuk could lead to aspiration for independence and in turn encourage separatist Kurds in Turkey .
iraqi opposition leader fear the United States be try to force Ahmed Chalabi , head of the london-based umbrella iraqi National Congress , on they as leader of a new iraqi administration .
Chalabi be the first top iraqi opposition leader to be airlift by the U.S. military into southern Iraq as the fight wound down , and he and other top member of he group plan to meet soon in Baghdad .
U.S. official say Chalabi be bring in because he offer force to the coalition .
neither Chalabi nor many other leader of anti-saddam group attend Tuesday 's meeting , but they send delegate .
Iraqis protest the conference say it do not represent they interest .
the protester hold banner write in English and arabic say the `` Hawza , '' or the shiite religious seminary in Najaf , represent they .
even some of those at the meeting say they do not want Garner lead the interim administration .
`` we will press for any iraqi civilian administration regardless of what the Americans say .
a administration by Garner be not acceptable , '' say Mowaffak al-Rubaie , a iraqi physician and opposition activist .
he say american official have outline what Garner 's administration would look like : each ministry would be head by a american , either military or civilian .
each minister would have two american deputy and eight american adviser , plus four iraqi adviser from inside the country and four iraqi exile .

`` I do not think we will discover anything , myself , '' Rumsfeld say at a meeting with Pentagon employee .
`` I think what will happen be we will discover people who will tell we where to go find it . ''

`` these people want the money and they believe it be rightfully they money , but they do not understand that the proper distribution be not first-come , first-served , '' say Col. Philip DeCamp , a battalion commander .

Baghdad resident gather outside the city 's police academy when word spread that some of the car loot in recent day have be recover .
still , more than a week after the regime collapse , Marine Staff Sgt. Jose Guillen say power have be restore _ by use of diesel plant _ to only about 500 home in Baghdad , a city of roughly 5 million .
he say U.S. force expect to get one of the city 's power grid on line by Friday .
unrest continue in other part of the country .
Americans seek to bring calm to Mosul , where U.S. troops kill 17 people in clash earlier in the week .
Brooks , briefing reporter at the U.S. Central command headquarters , also disclose that Marines have break up violent clash on Wednesday in Tikrit , Saddam 's hometown .
the fight break out between club-wielding member of the former ruler 's clan and a rival group , he say .
Clan rivalry aside , there be numerous other resentment shape event in the post-saddam era .
Majority Shiite Muslims be eager for power after decade of Saddam favor Sunni Muslims , for example .
and Kurds be eager to claim what they say Saddam take from they and give to Arabs in the northern part of the country .

one suggest the effort be organize from outside Iraq .

KUALA LUMPUR , Malaysia -lrb- AP -rrb- Malaysia 's second highest court on Friday reject a appeal by jail former Deputy Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim against he conviction and nine-year prison sentence for sodomy .
a three-judge panel of the Court of Appeals unanimously uphold a verdict by High Court Judge Arifin Jaka nearly three year ago that find Anwar guilty of sodomize he wife 's former driver .
Sodomy be a crime in this predominantly muslim southeast asian country .
Anwar be expect to appeal again with the Federal Court , Malaysia 's highest court .
speak to reporter after the verdict , Anwar lambast the judge , say they have be `` preselected '' by the government to quash he appeal .
`` these be spineless judge , '' Anwar say .
`` this decision be all script . ''
the judge also reject a application by Anwar to be release on bail .
but Anwar 's lawyer say they be file a fresh request for bail pend a further appeal .
on Monday , Anwar complete he sentence for a separate conviction on corruption charge , after the six-year sentence be reduce by one-third for good behavior .
he then begin serve the nine-year prison sentence for sodomy , he lawyer say .
Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad fire Anwar , he former protege , in 1998 follow dispute over financial policy .
Anwar lead large protest against Mahathir before he be arrest , charge and convict on corruption and sodomy charge .
Anwar claim the charge be fabricate to keep he from challenge Mahathir for power .
the government deny this .
human rights group Amnesty International say Friday 's verdict `` represent another step in the further deterioration in the human rights situation in the country . ''
`` this decision add to the already widespread perception that in politically sensitive case , the independence of the judiciary can no longer be guarantee , '' the london-based group say in a statement .
`` today , the situation look much bleaker . ''
Param Cumaraswamy , the U.N. special investigator on the freedom of judge and lawyer , say in a statement : `` so long as there be judge who be prepare to and continue to compromise the value and principle of they high office ... there be no hope for judicial independence and impartiality in the malaysian justice system . ''
about 200 demonstrator outside the court shout Anwar 's slogan of `` Reformasi ! ''
for political change .
police arm with automatic weapon stand by to prevent rowdiness .
the court also dismiss a joint appeal by Anwar 's adopt brother , Sukma Darmawan , who be convict together with Anwar for sodomy in August 2000 and sentence to six year in jail and whipping .
Sukma have be free on bail pending appeal , but the judge on Friday order he to begin he sentence .

UNITED NATIONS -lrb- AP -rrb- France on Tuesday propose immediately suspend U.N. sanction target Iraq civilian , a important step toward the U.S. goal of end trade embargo that have cripple the country 's economy .
the surprise move by France , which lead opposition to the U.S. war against Iraq , follow last week 's call by U.S. President George W. Bush for sanction to be lift quickly , so Iraq can trade freely and its oil revenue can be use to finance reconstruction .
France 's U.N. ambassador , Jean-Marc de La Sabliere , make the proposal at a Security Council meeting where member hear a briefing by chief U.N. weapon inspector Hans Blix and for the first time exchange view on potentially divisive postwar issue .
the proposal would end the U.N. ban on trade and investment in Iraq while leave a 12-year-old arm embargo in place .
the Security Council impose sanction after Iraq 's 1990 invasion of Kuwait .
under council resolution , sanction can not be lift until U.N. inspector certify that Iraq 's nuclear , chemical and biological weapon have be destroy along with the long-range missile to deliver they .
along with France , Russia , Germany and China also strongly oppose the war .
but de La Sabliere say before the meeting that Security Council `` must take into account the new reality on the ground . ''
russian Ambassador Sergey Lavrov have say he country be `` not at all oppose to the lifting of sanction . ''
but he say Russia want U.N. inspector to certify that Iraq have be disarm of all weapon of mass destruction , as require under U.N. resolution .
ask about the french proposal , he say : `` we be ready to discuss it . ''
at another closed-door council meeting later Tuesday , the council be to hear from Benon Sevan , head of the U.N. oil-for-food program , which have be provide food for 60 percent of Iraq 's 24 million people .
France 's de La Sabliere say he also propose that the council phase out the oil-for-food program , which allow Iraq to sell unlimited quantity of oil provide the money go for humanitarian goods and compensation to victim of the first Gulf War .
`` there should be some adjustment with a view of a phase out of this program , '' de La Sabliere say .
this be one of the difficult decision the council will face in the week ahead on divisive issue stem from the war against Iraq .
these include not only Iraq 's disarmament and the future of sanction but the U.N. role in Iraq now that the fighting be over , control of Iraq 's oil revenue , and lucrative reconstruction contract .
Blix stress that council resolution call for U.N. inspector to have access to all site and people in Iraq .
he say he tell the council that he believe the world would like Iraq 's disarmament confirm by a international body that have be involve in the country for over 10 year .
the Bush administration , which accuse Blix of hinder its drive for international support for the war , have already send its own team to Iraq to search for illegal weapon .
`` at the moment , the coalition have assume the responsibility for disarm Iraq , '' U.S. Ambassador John Negroponte , say Tuesday when ask whether U.S. team would work with U.N. inspector .
he say important scientist have turn themselves in , and the atmosphere have change which should enable any iraqi `` to speak more freely and speak without fear of retribution to those who be ask they the question . ''
France 's de La Sabliere say he also propose that the council `` find practical and pragmatic arrangement '' to coordinate and combine the work of the american team and the work of U.N. inspector `` so that the iraqi disarmament could be internationally verify . ''
he tell the Associated Press he envision sanction be suspend `` for a couple of month , '' and possibly renew .
he also envision U.S. and U.N. inspector work together .
`` and then sanction could be lift when a legitimate iraqi government be in place , '' he say .
in a interview with BBC radio air Tuesday , Blix say that before the war , the U.S. and Britain appear to have use `` shaky '' intelligence , include forge document , in a effort to prove Iraq have ban weapon .
Blix say it be `` very , very disturbing '' that U.S. intelligence fail to identify as fake document suggest Iraq try to buy uranium from the west african nation of Niger .
he tell reporter at the United Nations on Tuesday that the contract about `` yellow cake '' uranium `` be more than shaky , it be a fake . ''
U.N. inspector go back to Iraq for the first time in four year in late November and discover no weapon of mass destruction during 3 -lcb- month of search .
Secretary-General Kofi Annan order all U.N. international staff , include the inspector , to leave Iraq just before the war begin on March 20 .
he have say he expect they to return .
Annan also say Tuesday in Austria that Iraqis should be in charge of they own future and natural resource .
he acknowledge that `` the U.N. be be challenge '' but say he expect a agreement on the U.N. role in Iraq in the `` not too distant future . ''

SINGAPORE -lrb- AP -rrb- Singapore authority extend the use of its state-of-the-art thermal imaging scanner to fight the deadly sars virus by place unit at its border with Malaysia .
the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority say it begin a trial of the scanner Wednesday at its Woodlands and Tuas checkpoint to screen for people suffer from severe acute respiratory syndrome .
nine scanner , develop locally for military purpose , be place at Singapore 's Changi Airport last week to check people arrive from sars-affected country .
those who show up on the camera screen as `` hot body , '' or with a temperature greater than 37.5 degree Celsius -lrb- 99.5 degree fahrenheit -rrb- , will be pull aside .
each day about 90,000 people cross the border between Malaysia and Singapore .
any person find to be enter Singapore with a high temperature would be direct to a nearby nurse station for further check .
Singapore have report 16 death , the world 's third-highest toll , out of 186 infect from the flu-like illness .
globally , at least 236 people have die and more than 4,000 have become sicken with the illness .
Immigration and Checkpoints Authority spokeswoman Ngoon Pei Ling say during the trial period the scanner would be place at bus checkpoint , where passenger be already require to disembark for immigration purpose .
BEIJING -lrb- AP -rrb- talk between North Korea , the United States and China end Thursday with U.S. State Department official say it be uncertain whether discussion on Pyongyang 's nuclear program would continue .
although North Korea accuse the United States of lead the region toward war in its state media , U.S. official deny report the talk have break down .
North Korea also hint during the meeting that they have nuclear weapon and may conduct a test , a U.S. official say .
earlier , Secretary of State Colin Powell have tell a gathering of expert from the asia-pacific region that the talk have conclude , leave the impression there would not be a third day of discussion on Friday .
Powell also express hope that South Korea and Japan will be able to participate `` when and if '' there be another round of talk .
`` North Korea should not leave the meeting have the slightest impression that they might force we to make a concession we would not otherwise make , '' he add .
but U.S. State Department official , ask not to be identify , say there may be more meeting on Friday .
they say report of a breakdown in the talk be a `` misrepresentation . ''
one official say : `` we have the opportunity to say what we need to say and to hear what the North Koreans want to tell we . ''
a U.S. official say the North Koreans imply during the talk that they have nuclear weapon and that they may conduct a test .
but the official say there be no indication a test be imminent .
he acknowledge that preparation for a underground test could be conceal .
accord to the official , a north korean nuclear detonation would deplete by half they estimate stockpile of two weapon .
in Beijing , chief U.S. negotiator , Assistant Secretary of State James Kelly , decline to answer question , say only the side `` have talk . ''
Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Liu Jianchao refuse to provide detail , but say the talk be `` conducive to mutual understanding and finding way to resolve the north korean nuclear question peacefully . ''
discussion be schedule to end Friday , when Kelly be to fly to Seoul the same day to meet with south korean official .
the talk be the first high-level u.s.-north korean contact since tension over the North 's nuclear program spike six month ago over Washington 's claim that the North say in October it be try to develop nuclear weapon in violation of a 1994 pledge .
the North have dispute the U.S. claim .
Washington and its ally suspend fuel shipment to North Korea as punishment .
the North retaliate by withdraw from the nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty , expel U.N. inspector and restart a plutonium-producing reactor .
North Korea , which be seek a guarantee from the United States that it will not be attack , ratchet up the threat of conflict in a statement issue by its official korean Central News Agency accuse Washington of escalate tension .
the North 's leader fear they could be the next target for U.S. military action .
`` the situation on the korean Peninsula be so tense that a war may break out any moment due to the U.S. move , '' the KCNA statement say .
it say relation with the United States have hit `` rock bottom '' because U.S. President George W. Bush name North Korea as part of a `` axis of evil , '' along with Iran and Iraq .
KCNA say the war in Iraq have show the only way for a country to protect itself be to have a strong military deterrent .
official from Seoul and Washington say the swift u.s.-led victory in Iraq prompt North Korea to agree to the nuclear talk .
North Korea say the `` master key '' for successful talk be for the United States to drop its hostile policy toward Pyongyang .
in a likely reference to North Korea 's demand for a nonaggression treaty with Washington , KCNA say : `` the U.S. should settle the talk from a sincere stand and strive to settle the essential issue . ''
Washington have refuse to offer a formal treaty but say it would consider some sort of write assurance .
the North also likely want aid for its economy , which have be cripple by the loss of soviet subsidy and year of drought and mismanagement .
North Korea and China fight against the United States in the 1950-53 Korean War , which end without a peace treaty .
North Korea and Washington have no formal relation and be still technically at war .
China , the North 's ally and major aid donor , say it do not want Pyongyang to acquire nuclear weapon and have appeal for a negotiate settlement to the crisis .
a U.S. official praise the chinese contribution to the discussion .

BEIJING -lrb- AP -rrb- a accident on a diesel-powered chinese submarine have kill all 70 officer and sailor aboard , the official Xinhua News Agency report Friday .
the accident occur `` recently '' in chinese water east of the Neichangshan island , the brief chinese-language report say .
the island be in the Yellow Sea , between the northeastern province of Liaoning and North Korea .
the submarine be on a exercise when the accident occur , and `` because of a mechanical malfunction , the 70 crew member on board die , '' the Xinhua report say .
it do not give further detail or say how the crew die .
the vessel already have be tow back to a unidentified port , Xinhua say .
it say the hull number be 361 , which military analyst say appear to make it a ming-class submarine , a vessel use for patrol and coastal defense .
the announcement be unusual for a communist government that rarely acknowledge military accident .
it be the first time China have announce a fatal submarine mishap , say Bernard Cole , a professor at the U.N. National War College in Washington and a specialist on the chinese navy .
`` there have be rumor go around about the loss of submarine , but this be the first fatal accident that I know of , '' say Cole .
China 's military , which have a tradition of secrecy , do not comment about the accident Friday night .
foreign military analyst say it would be highly unusual for a accident to kill a whole submarine crew while still allow the vessel to be recover .
they suggest possible cause range from a sinking in shallow water to a disaster that flood the vessel with toxic chemical fume .
Michael McGinty , a expert on the chinese navy from the Royal United Services Institute for Defense study in London , say that the mishap likely happen while the submarine be on the surface .
if the accident happen when the vessel be underwater , it be less likely that China could have recover it , say McGinty , a former british submariner .
`` for a accident to have be so catastrophic when the submarine be on the surface , I find it a very mysterious thing , '' he say .
McGinty say that the submarine 's battery might have leak acid that mix with seawater , create toxic chlorine gas that kill the crew .
the torpedo might have leak propellant that poison the crew , he say .
the accident could have occur as long ago as March , say Cole , a former U.S. Navy antisubmarine warfare officer .
`` there have be exercise go on in the Yellow Sea over the past two month , '' he say .
`` this boat could have be involve in those exercise and go down over a month ago . ''
Cole say the loss of all hand suggest the vessel be flood or sink because of a collision or engineering problem .
he say ming-class sub usually carry a crew of 50 , suggest that the other aboard might have be technician or staff officer .
China begin build the ming-class sub in the 1970 , and they be obsolete by modern standard , accord to the Federation of American scientist .
the first three ming-class sub be complete between 1971 and 1979 , and one of they be scrap after a fire , accord to the web site of Jane 's Information Group , a lead of source defense information .
China be believe to have as many as 19 ming-class submarine .
China 's submarine fleet include 66 boat , most of they age diesel-electric vessel , McGinty say .
he say the fleet suffer from a chronic lack of money , training and maintenance .
but the Chinese be aggressively update they fleet with russian-made kilo-class diesel-electric sub .
`` the submarine force be the most potent part of the chinese navy , '' say Cole .
despite the difficulty of maintain a fleet , sub be valuable because they be hard to detect , Cole say .
in a conflict over Taiwan or some other confrontation , he say , `` China 's ability to field a force of even a dozen submarine could pose a big problem for any other naval force . ''
Xinhua say former President Jiang Zemin , who be chairman of the commission that run China 's military , on Friday send condolence to family member of the crew .
LONDON -lrb- AP -rrb- the United States and Britain be prepare a resolution that would give the United Nations a role in humanitarian relief but not peacekeep in Iraq , a senior official in U.S. President George W. Bush 's administration say Friday .
separately , the United States have decide to divide the military and humanitarian relief mission in Iraq into three part under American , British and Polish command , the official say , speak on condition of anonymity .
six european country have agree to contribute troops to the british and polish sector to create a international stability force , the official say .
the draft resolution would limit the U.N. role to help with refugee and displaced people , reconstruction and humanitarian assistance , the official say .
the United States and Britain agree on all but a few of the fine detail of the resolution , the official say , though there be no timetable on when it would be introduce .
U.N. official be already in Iraq provide humanitarian relief .
U.N. Secretary General Kofi Annan say this week that the body have no interest in police a postwar Iraq , although it could contribute to the political resuscitation of the country .
`` take the question of security .
I do not think the U.N. would want to take on that , '' Annan say .
`` there have be a suggestion that the U.N. want to take over the whole Iraq and run it , which be also not the case . ''
what the United Nations could contribute beyond humanitarian assistance be `` political facilitation , '' Annan say .
the propose draft resolution would probably face resistance from other U.N. Security Council member who have favor a u.n.-convened conference of the kind that help establish Afghanistan 's post-taliban government .
U.S. Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld discuss the resolution with Prime Minister Tony Blair and Defense Secretary Geoff Hoon on Friday as Rumsfeld return from a tour of Iraq , Afghanistan and the Persian Gulf region .
Rumsfeld say afterward he hope the U.N. would play a role but do not publicly discuss the draft resolution outline that role .
Hoon , who join Rumsfeld in a news conference at Heathrow airport , also do not mention the draft resolution .
`` we be right to be optimistic about the way forward '' in Iraq , Hoon say .
International stability force will be send to Iraq as soon as possible , the U.S. official say , though it be unclear when that would be .
those troops will work to restore and maintain order and supervise humanitarian project such as the restoration of water and electricity and delivery of food and medical aid .
the six nation contribute troops be Italy , Spain , Ukraine , Denmark , the Netherlands and Bulgaria , the official say .
representative of those country will meet with british official may 7 and polish official may 22 to determine what force each country will contribute and whether they will be put under british or polish command .
the U.S. part of the stability force will be comprise of american troops .
while that portion be likely to consist of a military division _ about 20,000 _ the troop strength of the other two sector have yet to be determine , the official say .
the international stabilization force would be under the U.S. war commander , Gen. Tommy Franks .
at least initially , the coalition stability force will augment rather than replace the 135,000 american troops inside Iraq , the official say .
the stability force will focus on provide security and humanitarian relief while other U.S. troops focus on root out leftover member of Saddam Hussein 's government and other armed element in Iraq .
Rumsfeld say , however , that the more troops other country contribute to the stability effort , the fewer U.S. troops will be need inside Iraq .
Planning for both the U.N. resolution and the international security force leave out France , Germany and Russia , three U.S. ally that vehemently oppose the war in Iraq .
some of the NATO member who agree to send troops may want NATO authorization for that action , the official say .
request for such authorization will be route through the alliance 's defense planning committee , which do not include France , the official say .
the outline for the international stability force be decide at a conference Hoon host Wednesday with representative from 16 country , mostly NATO member .
other country include the Philippines , South Korea , Qatar and Australia agree to send other help such as field hospital , engineer , explosive ordnance disposal team or nuclear , biological and chemical weapon expert .
the U.S. , British and Polish sector will be draw to take into account ethnic , religious , tribal and political faction within Iraq , the official say .
for example , although ethnic Kurds be the majority in large part of northern Iraq , there be also large number of Kurds within Baghdad .
some Arab country also want to play a role in the stability operation in Iraq but be reluctant to send troops because of political , religious and ethnic consideration , the official say .
country in the Gulf Cooperation Council have offer to donate money for the effort .
Rumsfeld also meet Friday with King Abdullah of Jordan , a american ally in the Middle East .
defense official say Jordan provide key help in the Iraq war , act as a staging area for U.S. special operation raid into western Iraq to prevent missile from be fire at Jordan or Israel .
Rumsfeld do not say what the two discuss .

no one be injure and no equipment be damage in the incident .

`` the inter-korean declaration on denuclearization of the korean Peninsula be thus reduce to a dead document due to the U.S. vicious hostile policy to stifle the dprk with nuke , '' say the North 's official news agency , kcna .
dprk stand for the democratic people 's republic of Korea , the North 's official name .
the announcement come as U.S. President George W. Bush and South Korean President Roh Moo-hyun be about to meet Wednesday in Washington to discuss North Korea 's nuclear program .
the accord be the last remaining legal obligation under which North Korea be ban from develop atomic arm .

Washington say it want to use dialogue to resolve the nuclear crisis , although U.S. official have not rule out a military option .

''

`` it be incumbent upon Pyongyang to give up its nuclear project and come forward as a responsible member of the international community , '' he say .
`` when the North take this route , the Republic of Korea and the international community will extend the necessary support and cooperation . ''

during the talk in Beijing , U.S. official say North Korea claim it already possess nuclear weapon , and that it have reprocess 8,000 spend nuclear fuel rod _ a move that could yield several atomic bomb within month .
North Korea offer to drop its nuclear and missile program in exchange for security guarantee and economic aid , accord to U.S. official .
the nuclear crisis flare in October , when Washington say North Korea admit have a secret nuclear program in violation of a 1994 treaty with Washington .

the rover be expect to travel up to 132 foot -lrb- 39.6 meter -rrb- each Martian day , which be 24 hour and 39 -lcb- minute long .
the mission be expect to last three month but could run longer .
the rover eventually will shut down as dust build up on they solar panel and they will remain on the planet .
only 12 out of 30 previous attempt have reach Mars , and only three out of nine attempt have succeed in landing on the planet .

during they first war summit on March 27 at Camp David , Blair and Bush become divide over what a role the United Nations will play in postwar Iraq , when Bush give no positive reaction to Blair 's suggestion of a strong UN role .
after the Camp David talk , Blair , who analyst say have be pursue a special relationship with Washington in order to restore Britain 's traditional role as a transatlantic `` bridge '' , be force to readjust he tone .
Blair and Bush be expect to bridge they gap on the issue by reach a agreement on UN role in post-war Iraq , some analyst say even before this summit at Hillsborough , south of Belfast , the second of its kind since the war break out on March 20 .
in a joint write statement , the two ally pledge to seek UN Security Council resolution to affirm Iraq 's territorial integrity , ensure aid delivery and endorse a `` appropriate '' post - conflict administration for Iraq .
`` we welcome the appointment by the United Nations Secretary - General of a special adviser for Iraq to work with the people of Iraq and coalition representative , '' the statement add .
the United Nations would have a `` vital role '' in the effort to repair Iraq 's infrastructure , Blair tell reporter at a news conference after he talk with Bush , downplay UN role in emphasize that ultimately the country must be run by the iraqi people .

it be a `` false choice '' to debate whether Iraq should be run by coalition force or the United Nations , say Blair , who be believe to be in favor of a stronger UN role in post-conflict Iraq than Bush .
echo Blair , Bush say the UN would play a role in all aspect of post-war Iraq , from humanitarian aid to a future interim authority , add that Iraq would `` move as quickly as possible '' to a interim authority make up of Iraqis from inside and outside the country .
however , when press on what precisely the UN role would be , Bush on Tuesday mention only humanitarian work , `` suggest '' people to staff the interim authority and help Iraq `` progress . ''
`` when we say vital role for the United Nations , we mean vital role for the United Nations in all aspect of the issue , whether it be humanitarian aid , or whether it be help to stand up a interim authority .
the iraqi people will decide who be on the iraqi interim authority , '' say Bush .
Bush do not spell out how much power the United Nations would have , nor do he elaborate on Washington 's plan to place US official alongside Iraqis in the interim administration .
difference still remain between the United States and Britain , analyst say , over the speed with which Iraq should be hand to a interim iraqi administration , and the extent to which a us-led group of general and former diplomat should effectively run the country .
yet , analyst argue , both Britain and the United States hope they agree vision of a postwar scenario will placate anti-war nation such as France , Germany and Russia .
`` we will move as quickly as possible to place governmental responsibility under the control of a interim authority compose of Iraqis from both inside and outside the country , '' Bush vow at the joint news conference with Blair , add that the interim authority would serve until a permanent government could be choose by the iraqi people .
`` rebuild of Iraq will require the support and expertise of the international community .
we be commit to work with international institution , include the United Nations , which will have a vital role to play in this task , '' Bush add .
Blair also plead the world to avoid `` endless diplomatic wrangle '' over the future of Iraq like the international dispute over a second UN resolution on Iraq that precede the war .
France and Germany , which be most vocal in oppose this US - lead war against Iraq , have be insist that the United Nations should play a central role in the phase of post-war Iraq .
on the unresolved dispute between Europe and the United States , analyst say , Blair might again have to make a difficult choice , but he be very likely to support the United States , which Britain can not afford to fall out with .

seven prosecutor read in turn the indictment against Ba'asyir at the makeshift court room in the Meteorology and Geophysics Agency 's office in Central Jakarta .
the authority have move the trial venue for security reason and to allow wider media coverage .
Ba'asyir be not officially charge with the Bali bombing last October , but police say he give he blessing to the Bali perpetrator .
Police believe Ba'asyir be the spiritual leader of Jemaah Islamiyah , the terrorist network in Southeast Asia which be widely blame for the Bali bombing .
accord to the Criminal Code , treason be punishable with a possible death penalty .
Ba'asyir have publicly deny any wrongdoing and refuse to answer police question .

PRAGUE , June 9 -lrb- Xinhua -rrb- Czech President Vaclav Klaus on Monday appoint Miroslav Kostelka as the country 's new defense minister to replace Jaroslav Tvrdik who resign from the post in late May .
the decision be make in response to the recommendation of Prime Minister Vladimir Spidla .
Kostelka , 52 , be first deputy defense minister and a ex - general .
at the end of last month , Tvrdik submit he resignation in protest against plan cut in defense spending as part of the government 's finance reform .
under the planned package of public finance reform , only 2.05 percent of the country 's gross domestic product -lrb- gdp -rrb- will be allocate for the defense budget .
Tvrdik say the military reform could not be complete thoroughly with so little money .
Tvrdik , who take over the defense ministry in May 2001 , also announce that he would quit he post in the parliament and give up he position in the rule party Social Democrats .
Prime Minister Spidla say Monday that the ongoing military reform should continue , with regard to the government 's plan public finance reform .
the appointment mark the second change of the cabinet post since the spidla-led government come into power in July 2002 .

LUXEMBOURG , June 16 -lrb- Xinhua -rrb- Foreign minister of the European Union -lrb- EU -rrb- say here Monday that they fully support stricter nuclear inspection of Iran 's nuclear program by the International atomic Energy Agency -lrb- IAEA -rrb- .
a statement issue at the two-day meeting of the EU foreign minister call on Iran to conclude and implement urgently and unconditionally a additional protocol to the nuclear non - proliferation Treaty allow for short-notice inspection of suspect nuclear site in the country .

they also say that the EU be closely follow the nuclear issue and would revert it to the forthcoming debate of the IAEA meeting on Tuesday .
JINAN , June 24 -lrb- Xinhua -rrb- China late this year will start build a nuclear-powered desalinator project in Yantai City in east China 's Shandong Province , with a design capacity of produce 52 million ton of fresh water a year .
official with the Development Planning Commission of the Shandong provincial government say the project , to be build in cooperation with Qinghua University , would alleviate water shortage in the city and other part of the Shandong Peninsula .
Yantai and other part of Shandong suffer acute water shortage due to drought in recent year , change climate and other reason .
approve by the State Development and Reform Commission , the project be expect to cost 1.6 billion yuan -lrb- nearly 200 million US dollar -rrb- .
Zhang Zuoyi , director of the nuclear Energy Technology and Design Institute attach to Qinghua University , be quote in Monday 's Beijing Evening News as say the fresh water to be produce from the project will cost 3.75 yuan per ton , much less than the cost of water from exist source .
the project be expect to use a 200-megawatt nuclear-powered reactor design by the institute , accord to the paper .
the project would be complete and operational in 2007 , it say .

Ben Myers Mon , 28 Feb 2005 01:58:35 GMT Re : Dell sue for `` bait and switch '' and false promise then there be the class action suit against Gateway bring by some Philadelphia lawyer a number of year ago .
gateway advertise and sticker many of its 486 computer as `` Pentium Ready '' , mean that a special type 3 zif socket Pentium OverDrive could be install and run .
Micronics design the motherboard use by Gateway , and the basis of the design be a prototype Pentium OverDrive with a internal write-through cache , a more conservative cache design .
then Intel change the Pentium OverDrive , and the final version have a write-back cache .
when install in a Gateway system , the chip run slower than slow , maybe about as fast as a IBM AT , and bus-mastering device like nic and scsi card refuse to work .
so the lawyer sue Gateway , and the settlement approve by the judge consist of megabuck for the lawyer and coupon to owner of Gateway 486 computer .
the coupon be good for $ 50 off on the purchase of a Pentium OverDrive processor from Gateway , at its usual inflated price !!!
so , let 's see .
what do a discount coupon for a processor I can not use in my system do for I ?
I wonder how many people gleefully cash in they coupon and buy Pentium OverDrives from Gateway .
Intel eventually compensate by make available a `` interposer '' , a little socketed thingie install between the Pentium OverDrive and the zif socket .
the sole purpose of the interposer be to raise a signal on the CPU to force its cache to operate in the write-thru mode which be compatible with most zif socket 3 486 motherboard .
needless to say , this be the least successful `` OverDrive '' CPU ever do by Intel .
the 486-dx4 overdrive be ok , as be several socket 5 Pentium OverDrives and the socket 8 Pentium pro OverDrive .
finally Intel give up on overdrive ... Ben Myers Nascar12 Sun , 27 Feb 2005 22:45:13 -0500 Re : Dell sue for `` bait and switch '' and false promise believe it or not there be company that go over the line and need to be hit with a stick call a law suit .

instead , if the cop pick she up , she can be ship back without delay .

Eliyahu Michael Jacobs Mon , 06 Dec 2004 10:08:56 -0500 Re : waiver of extradition mean what she be go to have a lot of separate offens to account for by this time .
2 `` fta `` s -lrb- failure to appear -rrb- , one in fl and one in AZ , plus whatever the original charge be in both case .
that mean she have give up the right to force the fl authority to go thru legal due process in demand that the AZ authority turn she over to they for further prosecution .
all the fl prosecutor have to do be ask , and the AZ jailer will pack she up in a van or a plane and ship she back to fl for trial on the FTA charge and probably to commence she serve time under the suspend sentence that go along with she original probation .
she be in DEEP SH __ t if you have not already figure that out .
nowhere in USA would be far enough if she waive extradition .
of course they do .
that be what she waiver of extradition mean they could do .
they let she serve she time in AZ , then they come and get she to serve she time in fl .
this be what happen when people blow off the chance they be give to straighten out by be give probation .
thumb you nose at the court often enough , and they will bring all sort of crap down on you head , re-institute the original suspend sentence and possibly add on for the FTA .
what be it good for ?
it be good for the state , not for the convict .
it let they skip some of the legal procedure she would otherwise be entitle to , in order to ship she from one state to another .
but they be entitle to demand that waiver as a condition of probation ; if she have not agree to voluntarily waive that right , they probably would have just throw she in jail for the 3 year sentence the first time around and she would not have be give the chance to go straight during probation and avoid jail altogether .
she do not have a lot of leeway here .
she have do this numerous time and they be not likely to give she another wide open chance like they do the first 3 time .
she will probably have to serve out she sentence in fl , and if she have not already serve all she time in AZ , they will then ship she back there to do that time .

-- Tom Healy , CPA Boulder , CO web : shyster1040 fri , 18 Feb 2005 08:32:13 -0500 Re : S Corp Profit distribution and bankrupcy .
be the trustee inform of the transfer of the share ?
since you give you uncle the share prior to he discharge , the share should have become asset available to the bankruptcy estate for the satisfaction of debt .
if the share transfer be report to the trustee and the trustee do nothing about they , then you may be ok ; however , if you fail to inform the trustee , then you uncle may be liable for hide asset , which would , at the minimum , invalidate he discharge .
even if the transfer do not invalidate the whole discharge , the distribution might be subject to forfeiture to pay creditor ' claim if you fail to inform the trustee of the share transfer .
you need to speak to a bankruptcy attorney pronto ; this be a bankruptcy matter , not a tax matter .
superprimen...@gmail.com 18 Feb 2005 10:49:15 -0800 Re : S Corp Profit distribution and bankrupcy .
the bankrupcy filing take place in 2003 , but it didnt clear until early 2004 and that be when i give he the share .
he have no share in 2003 .
shyster1040 fri , 18 Feb 2005 14:21:23 -0500 Re : S Corp Profit distribution and bankrupcy .
yes , but accord to the fact you first give , he have not yet receive the bankruptcy discharge when you give he the share .
I believe you have say that you give he the share in February 2004 but that the discharge do not come until June of 2004 .
that mean that he receive the share while he be still in bankruptcy , which mean that the share be potentially asset that the trustee could use to pay off creditor .
a bankruptcy case do not close until you get the discharge order , and until then everything that the debtor receive be fair game for the trustee .
if the trustee be inform of the share and do nothing about it , you be more likely than not ok , but if the trustee be not inform of the fact directly , then you may be in trouble .
if , however , you uncle receive the share after he obtain a order of discharge from the bankruptcy court , then as a general matter the creditor can not go after the share , unless they can prove that there be collusion between you and you uncle to hide he asset from they -lrb- e.g. , by put he asset in the corporation 's name and then wait until after the bankruptcy to transfer the share to he -rrb- .

ethical and legal issue in hire Marinello Petrel Sat , 18 Dec 2004 02:11:28 GMT Ethical and legal issue in hire Marinello it have be suggest that there be , or be at one time , some sort of delegate ' motion which establish a minimum period between the time someone could leave the EB and the time someone could be hire by the USCF .
I do not know if this be so , and I really think it be sort of irrelevant .
it be irrelevant because the REAL question be whether a active board member can , while on the board , arrange to be give money by the USCF .
of course it be in the bylaw that a active board member can not be give money by the uscf while on the board .
it ought to be pretty obvious that it would be entirely contrary to the spirit of this for a active board member to be money after leave the board .
suppose , for example , there be to be a proposal to the effect that each EB member would be give $ 10,000 upon the expiration of his/her term .
clearly this would be a transparent attempt to evade the bylaw and would fail .
if the board can not vote to give themselves present money , they can not vote to give themselves future money either .
furthermore , it do not matter whether this arrangement be embody in a EB vote or not , or whether the discussion of the proposal take place in a formal EB meeting or not .
a board member , while on the board , be suppose to be represent the interest of the USCF , not feather his/her nest , in the present or in the future .
if a board member make such arrangement , it be clearly a ethic violation , clearly a violation of the bylaw , possibly endanger we tax-exempt status , and be possibly a violation of law as well .
the purpose of have a `` time limit '' would be as a mechanism to ensure compliance with the above principle ; that be , you would have a time limit because it would reduce the likelihood that someone would be tempt to violate the above prohibition ; it would give the voter time to elect a new EB that would consider the issue objectively .
of course , it be possible that someone could leave the board - without - ever have discuss be compensate by the board in the future , and that then the remain member could , for good reason , hire that person .
it would create question among the suspicious - and avoid this appearance of wrongdoing would be another good reason for a time limit - but it would not automatically be a ethic or bylaw violation .
but this be neither here nor there , because the fact that Randy Bauer be already talk about Beatriz Marinello as the USCF 's new `` move coordinator '' , whatever that involve , and whether or not it mean that she would be the de facto interim ED , mean that at some level and in some form these discussion HAVE already take place , while Marinello be serve as President .

so the ` time limit ' issue do not even come up .
we pretty much know that Marinello , while on the board , have arrange to get future money from the USCF .
so we already have a problem .
if this be not a problem , I wish someone would explain to I why not .
now , Stan B. argue that Marinello 's service be in fact indispensible as move coordinator , and that ethic standard be not a suicide pact , so that since we absolutely need she the EB have the right to go ahead and retain she .
I agree with the principle .
but I think that to make this argument work the EB would have to produce some evidence that Marinello really be indispensible for this task .
this would have to include evidence that the EB have consider all the alternative , include : - delegate the whole thing to the Interim ED , which would be the normal practice in normal organization with a ed - ask the Interim ED to designate someone from the New Windsor staff to act as move coordinator - ask the Interim ED to hire some other consultant with experience in office relocation to manage the job -lrb- there be such people -rrb- - conduct some kind of actual search for candidate for the position during the last two month since the move be decide upon if they do consider alternative , it would also have to include evidence that Marinello have much more experience at relocate office than other people , or be willing to do the job cheaper -lrb- although this would not constitute be `` indispensible '' in my view -rrb- .

and someone say , `` Beatriz , how about you ? ''

there be one Carousel organization again rapid T. Rabbit 17 Feb 2005 17:19:51 -0800 there be one Carousel organization again I just receive the latest issue of Merry-Go-Roundup , the quarterly publication of the National Carousel Association .
in it be a blurb report that the american Carousel Society have recently disband .
some of you may be wonder why there be two carousel organization in the first place .
the National Carousel Association be found in the early 1970 's by a group of art historian and collector , include Frederick Fried , author of the 1964 book `` a pictorial history of the Carousel '' that single-handedly give the classic hand-carved wooden carousel the respect and appreciation it deserve .
other founder include Charlotte Dinger , who be already a major collector of carousel artwork at the time .
the purpose of the NCA be `` to promote conservation , appreciation , knowledge and enjoyment of the art of the classic wooden carousel and especially the preservation of complete wooden carousel . ''
the organization attract a wide range of member , include carousel enthusiast , owners/operators , theme and amusement park , museum , library , those in the entertainment/recreation industry , art collector and even auction house , among other .
it be the presence of these last two name group that would eventually stir up controversy .
thanks in large part to the NCA , the art of the carousel be receive a lot of public attention and appreciation that it have not enjoy before .
however , this new and brighter spotlight on these antique ride also have the unfortunate effect of enhance the collectibility and monetary value of operational carousel .
they have become worth more money dead -lrb- i.e. in piece -rrb- than alive -lrb- i.e. function -rrb- .
as such , during the 1980 's many beautiful and unique wooden carousel would be break up at the auction block , as owner rush to cash in on the antique marketplace .
the liability insurance crisis further aggravate the situation , as amusement park operator seek to cut they loss , while at the same time liquidate underperform carousel to raise capital for the purchase of newer and more profitable -lrb- thrill -rrb- ride .
some collector of carousel art and auction house be accuse of use they NCA affiliation to gain information about vintage carousel that they could target for breakup to they own personal profit , a practice certainly contrary to the state goal of the organization .
the increase rift between the `` preservationist '' and `` collector '' would eventually boil over into a internal political struggle that cause many in the collector faction of the NCA to walk out of the group , include founder such as Charlotte Dinger and other .
the preservationist would choose to remain with the NCA , include Fred Fried .
at this time in the late 1970 's , carousel artwork collector and printer Marge Swenson be the editor of the NCA 's Merry-Go-Roundup publication .
the political struggle that occur within the nca result in two slate of officer be present for approval to the membership , something that be not suppose to happen .
a thicker-than-usual issue of the Roundup would be fill with accusation from both faction in the group each accuse the other of improper behavior .
Swenson herself would also leave the NCA .
not much later , she begin publish she own magazine call `` Carousel Art '' , which be essentially a scholarly photo album depict different carver and style each month .
meanwhile , those collector who leave the National Carousel Association band together to form the american Carousel Society -lrb- ACS -rrb- , whose state aim of carousel preservation also recognize collector as a positive asset towards that goal .
for the next couple of decade , the two carousel organization would co-exist , each attract its share of member .
some would actually join both group , and even attend both of they annual convention .
during the mid-1980 's Walter Louck would begin publish `` the Carousel Trader '' , later rename `` the Carousel News & Trader '' .
this monthly magazine would cover all angle and side of the story of the carousel and be well receive by all carousel enthusiast .
about a decade later , Carousel Art would suddenly cease publication .
the NCA would continue to issue the Roundup to its member .
the mid to late 1990 's see the passing of NCA founder Fred Fried , and also that of Charlotte Dinger , both who represent the two opposite point of view in the carousel preservation debate .
coincidentally and amazingly , the art of building hand-carved carousel -lrb- and even bandorgan -rrb- have be revive , with firm such as Carousel Works and Carousel Magic again build the popular ride in classic design .
this development seem to have greatly alleviate the antique marketplace pressure that have doom so many legacy wooden carousel over the past several decade .
the turn of the new millenium actually witnessese a thaw in the relationship between the National Carousel Association and American Carousel Society , as newer and younger leadership take over from the founding generation .
the two group decide that the bickering between they be wasteful , conterproductive and pointless .
there be talk of a -lrb- re -rrb- merger but the regulation govern non-profit prevent that .
however , it be decide that NCA and ACS hold joint convention to save on cost to both the club and the member .
just within the past couple of month though , the american Carousel Society have determine that they do not have the funding to continue with the operation of they organization and officially cease to exist .
so now , once again there be a single nationwide organization to join if you love carousel !
rapid T. Rabbit

Meiji Japan be drive to emulate what it think the West be do in every facet of society .

as part of the catch-up effort , she whole-heartedly enter into the Imperialist game in Asia , be treat as a equal -lrb- relative to she power -rrb- by the other power .
however , after World War I , Japan fail to recognize a fundamental shift in the attitude of she former Imperial partner ; they begin a long , slow process of disengage themselves from they former Imperial area , from they colony , in addition to outright stop all expansion .
Japan choose to read this as a sign that the West have lose its power and resolve , and that Japan be the rightful heir to Imperial mantle in Asia .

this drain be greatly accelerate by Japan 's invasion of China proper in 1936 .

domestic consumption fall , consumer goods become scarce , and the use of materiale for war purpose eat into Japan 's domestic industry .

in order to seize they , she feel she have to attack and destroy the naval power of the US .

David Ross Sat , 19 Feb 2005 11:29:45 -0800 Re : Board Member Compensation in IRS publication 557 , the sample draft article of incorporation indicate that no compensation may be pay to director .
in fairness , reimbursement of out-of-pocket expense on behalf of the organization -- include travel and lodging to attend board meeting -- be allow .
however , publication 557 do not explicitly prohibit compensation to director .
as far as state law go , you must follow the law for the state -lrb- 1 -rrb- in which the organization be incorporate and -lrb- 2 -rrb- in which the organization operate .
for a organization that be incorporate in Maryland and have its headquarters in Maryland , the law of Maryland apply without regard to the state in which the director live .
remember , a corporation be legally a `` person '' , distinct from the corporeal person who govern , manage , and operate the corporation .
thus , the law apply to the corporate person be the law of the state where that person `` life '' .

it be not acceptable policy and not legal to pay a honorarium or stipend to director of charity .
I check with a lawyer familiar with canadian charity law , who explain that it be not permit to remunerate board member of charity for they service as board member .
the prohibition do not apply to director of nonprofit organization that be not charity .
in the USA , the rule vary from state to state .
some state permit board member of charity to be compensate , but it be generally not do .
donor , funder , and the general public share the view that director of charity should act gratuitiously .
it be permit everywhere , however , to reimburse director for necessary expense incur in order to serve .
if you organization be a charity , you need to check you state law and act very carefully if you be consider pay board member .

t09 :01:00 hand in hand with any consideration of the redistricting process , we shoul give some think to the structural relationship between the state House and Senate .
currently , each House member represent approximately 75,000 Virginians , while each Senator represent appoximately 187,500 .
often as not , there be no rational commonality between the two .
some senator represent people pool that be in turn fracture into five or six House district .
I believe this account , in large part , for the dysfunction that characterize we state government now .
former governor Gerald Baliles , in this same vein , have advocate a realignment of the two house in a way that serve commonality .
he have suggest that we either increase membership in the Senate to 50 , or decrease House membership to 80 , produce a scenario wherein 1 Senator would represent a block of people who be represent by exactly 2 Delegates .
he think -- and I think he be right -- that this arrangement would foster a closer working relationship between the Senate and the House .
you certainly would not have these dysfunctional grouping we now have , where 1 Senator often represent a population divide among half a dozen Delegates of two party -- three , if you count independent .
